tasks.task: Conducting a diversified farm and ranch operation
subtasks: Managing cattle grazing on pastures
Harvesting corn, alfalfa, grass hay, wheat, and silage corn
Hosting wedding and private events at the vineyard and winery
Operating a winery that produces 100% Wyoming-grown wines and other beverages
Maintaining vineyards through labor-intensive pruning and harvesting
Rotating crops to optimize soil health and yield
Converting unproductive cropland into wetlands and grassland habitats
Protecting crops from wildlife damage (e.g., deer attacking corn and grapes)
Enhancing public perception and agro-tourism through landscape improvements
Implementing water-saving irrigation techniques (e.g., subsurface irrigation)
Turning some cropland into ecological areas (wetlands, grassland)
Preserving natural habitats for wildlife (e.g., wetland for Sandhill cranes)
Supporting local wildlife (e.g., wild turkey, deer, Sandhill cranes)
Improving the aesthetic and ecological value of farm non-crop areas
Promoting agro-tourism and land stewardship through public events and wine production
Incorporating water conservation practices and new irrigation systems
Focusing on short-season varieties of corn for better yield
Regularly evaluating and introducing new corn varieties suited to local soil conditions
Maximizing outputs while minimizing input costs
Addressing the labor-intensive nature of vineyard management (e.g., hand pruning, hand picking)
Rotating enterprise focus (e.g., custom cattle feeding, dry edible beans) to manage resources
Coordinating various agricultural and non-agricultural activities on the same land
